str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To tarry, continue, stay in a place. From dia and the base of tribos; to wear through, i.e. Remain.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To speak freely, boldly; To be confident.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
A hand.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of semaino; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally.
And, even, also, namely.
A wonder, portent, marvel. Of uncertain affinity; a prodigy or omen.
